page_analysis.text_content:
Below-grade patios standards
& site planning

• Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard.

• Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater and no single area may exceed 200 sf. Note area devoted to required stairway egress shall not be included in the 200 sf limitation.

• Each such area is separated from another by at least 10'.

• Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 2' max.

• Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'.

• The combined length of all the excavated features or portions of features that encroach into the required yards, on all sides of the structure, may not exceed 15'.

• Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees.

• Public Works Department must approve drainage system.

• Overhangs or canopies installed to shelter such area shall count towards lot coverage.

• Such areas to be architecturally compatible with residence.

• Such areas to be screened to off site views by means of landscaping and/or fencing as determined appropriate by Planning Dept.

Fig 40 Examples of site plan w/below-grade patios

Key
_____ Curb
_____ lot line
[hatched pattern] Sidewalk
[hatched pattern] Required
[hatched pattern] setbacks
[dashed line] Buildable
[dashed line] area
[solid black] Dwelling
[solid black] Lightwells
[solid black] & stairwells
[white box] Lightwells
[white box] & stairwells
[white box] that encroach
[white box] into required
[white box] yards
[wavy line] Landscaping
[wavy line] screening

Below-grade patios
• If [encroaching features] may not exceed 15'
• No single below-grade patio may not exceed 200 sf
• Combined areas of all below-grade patio areas may not exceed 2% of the lot area or 200 sf, which ever is greater
Note: measurements are based on interior dimension of opening and exclude encasing structure.

43

visual_elements.description: Site plan showing examples of below-grade patios with two dwelling units (Main dwelling and 2nd dwelling), landscaping screening, required setbacks, and various measurements including 10' min. separation, 2' max. encroachment, and 4' max. encroachment. Shows front yard, rear yard, and interior lot example with curb, lot lines, and buildable areas marked.
visual_elements.location: Right side of page, taking up approximately 60% of the page width

visual_elements.description: Key/legend showing different line types and patterns used in the site plan diagram, including curb, lot line, sidewalk, required setbacks, buildable area, dwelling, lightwells & stairwells, and landscaping screening
visual_elements.location: Lower left portion of the diagram area

sections: Fig 40 Examples of site plan w/below-grade patios

additional_notes: Page number 43 appears at bottom right
Diagram includes hatched patterns, solid fills, dashed lines, and wavy lines to represent different elements
Note about measurements being based on interior dimension of opening and excluding encasing structure
cross_references: Reference to Planning Dept. for screening determination
Reference to Public Works Department for drainage system approval

qualifiers.text: Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard
Note area devoted to required stairway egress shall not be included in the 200 sf limitation
on all sides of the structure
as determined appropriate by Planning Dept.
measurements are based on interior dimension of opening and exclude encasing structure

conditions.text: Such features may not be located on the side of the structure that faces the front yard
Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater
conditions.threshold_value: 2% of lot area OR 200 sf (whichever is greater)

conditions.text: no single area may exceed 200 sf
Each such area is separated from another by at least 10'
Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 2' max
The combined length of all the excavated features or portions of features that encroach into the required yards may not exceed 15'
Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'
Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring trees
Public Works Department must approve drainage system
Such areas to be architecturally compatible with residence
Such areas to be screened to off site views by means of landscaping and/or fencing

logical_relationships.expression: Combined area limits AND single area limits must both be met
Individual encroachment limits AND combined encroachment length limit must all be met
All conditions must be satisfied simultaneously

execution_sequence.action: Verify location is not on front yard side of structure
Obtain Public Works Department approval for drainage
Implement screening as determined by Planning Department
